data.title: Great for young kids
data.text: We have a membership to this museum so we can go spend an hour or two when it is too cold or too hot to be outside.  They have recently updated some of the rooms and the kids never get tired of shopping in "Wondermart."

data.title: Occasional Visitor
data.text: Exhibits are average. Building is quite old and doesn't feel very bright, cheery and/or clean (not sure how the kids feel but that's a parent perspective!). The young kids have enjoyed it on occasion. Seems a bit pricey when compared to other nicer museums. However, it is a great spot for a couple of hours with the young kids.

data.title: What fun
data.text: What a fun place to take the little ones! Both the 4 and 2 year old had a great time. Be sure kids wear play clothes - there are aprons but washable paint and markers in the art room and the water in the water room might not work so well with dress clothes. The price is very reasonable.

data.title: Desperately needs an update
data.text: Still a great place to take young kids for some interactive, hands on experience. Allow a couple of hours.  This site was formerly a grade school, so each former classroom has a theme if you will.  There is a small gift shop with some unique things.  I hear there is a much needed renovation in the near future - hope so.

data.title: Wonderscope
data.text: Take your preschoolers and early elementary children to Wonderscope where they are free to explore their world through age-appropriate activities and rooms!

data.title: Great for 2.5 year old
data.text: Yes, the musuem has some items that are showing a little wear and could potentially use a good scrub. However cleanliness at any kids attraction is just an illusion so washing up well afterwards is a must no matter where you go. The point to me at least is that my 2.5 year old learned something and had a good time. We stayed for about 3 hours and would have stayed longer if we had not gotten hungry. I am pretty sure we could come here for a few hours a couple times a month and still have a good and educational time. My only suggestion is that you call first and see how busy they are. When we went there were 3 separate daycare groups of mostly older kids that were a little roudy and would desend on rooms in clumps. Not the kids fault they were just excited , but really the adults should have put them in smaller groups. Instead we kept having to switch rooms before we were ready so that my daughter wasn't being pushed off of stations by kids 5 or more years older than her.

data.title: Wonderful adventure for kids and parents
data.text: Attended a birthday party at Wonderscope.  What a wonderful hidden gem in Shawnee.  Rooms full of child activities; hands on for children to explore and play.  Everyone had the best time.  Can't wait to go again with the grandkids

data.title: Great fun for toddlers and preschoolers
data.text: Took a toddler and we spent a couple of hours in just one room with golf balls and tracks. Second room was the Farm to Market display - utterly adorable. Little ones can collect eggs from the "chickens" and pick vegetables. Then they can go shopping, complete with child-sized carts and a grocery store-like check-out. Just like Mom and Dad.

data.title: Cool for the kids!
data.text: Our daughter loved it! Her imagination soared as she ran from room to room playing with dolls, groceries, boats, and balls. At 2 years old, she LOVED talking to the Guinea pigs. However, the place was supposed to close at 4:30 but at 4pm they turned off the lights and closed the doors to the play rooms. We paid our entry fee, so them staring at their watches and tapping their feet wasn't about to run us out 30 minutes early. I guess we figured out why the place was practically empty.

data.title: Moms club outting
data.text: This place is awesome. For so many reasons. #1! Is that my kids loved every single second. They are 5 and 3. And #2. I loved that each room was small (it's an old school house) and one door so you can stand at the door and know they are safe inside. #3. They have a variety of play for each gender. It was only $7. But, we got a group discount of $5. Totally worth it and the drive. Since we are way up by liberty. I will go back for sure. We even reserved a room for lunch.

data.title: Great for 5 and under, but not much else
data.text: I am a local, I grew up going to Wonderscope and even volunteered here in college.it has gone down hill slowly bin the last couple of years. They only have 9 rooms now and every time we go there , there is something else they took away. The exhibits that are there are very good, like the art room.  Now, I don't Wonderscope for the disappearing exhibits, the state of Kansas got rid of all funding for museums, so they don't have a lot of money to work with. Since this is now a small museum it is great for small children who have a shorter attention span.

data.title: Goldmine for ages 2-10
data.text: This is the most wonderful place to spend a rainy day with the kids. There are several interactive rooms, each one different from another.  A water room, where your child can put on a plastic vest and put their hands into water steering boats. A doctor/medical clinic room, with practice stethoscopes and baby dolls your child can practice on and more. An art room, complete with face paint, paper, scissors, colors and ribbon that your child can create a piece of art with, and a sandbox is within this particular room. A large Lego room, with many lego built mini stations, some your child can climb into, like a pretend Spaceship complete with spaceship furnishings. A little picnic table area in the large Lego room you can eat lunch with your child (bring your own). A mini grocery store, complete with register and carts, your child can "Shop" and pay. A little golf ball railway course, your child can drop golfballs down ramps and the balls will flip with gravity, or they can aim balls into buckets. An Astronaut room, where your child can put on a spacesuit and stand in a pretend spaceship with controls. Lots more, this is a Gem!

data.title: great for young children!
data.text: Kids love to play here.  I have9 grandkids and they all love coming here.  Something of interest for all.  They get to let their imagination run.  Some rooms need dinner updating,but the kids don't notice.  I would say that kids under6 would enjoy this most.  The price is right for sure and they have season passes.

data.title: Child's Fun Day
data.text: Excellent learning experience for children with "hands on" equipment for them to try.  Plant flowers and vegetables outside.  Children never tire of going to Wonderscope.

data.title: Kids love it. Average overall
data.text: Kids have a great time. The rooms and toys are really old and could use updating. A good place to go in the winter when you need to spend time out of the house.

data.title: Great learning and fun kids musuem
data.text: My grandkids of all ages up to ten like going there to experience the different rooms.  The golf ball room is always a favorite as well as the art room. We always spend time I'm the submarine too

data.title: Good kids museum, oh, and it's free.
data.text: A nice and clean kids museum.   It's free, which is even better.   It's small and intimate.   It's not cutting edge like some of the larger scale city kids museum's, but that's what is nice?   The post office is my kids favorite.    He will play endlessly sorting and delivering mail.  This is probably best for kids younger than 7.

data.title: Great visit for 5 year olds
data.text: A good time was had by two 5 year olds and two 2 year olds. Could do with some updating but if you go with moderate exportations you will be pleasantly surprised. The children loved the nursery/clinic.

data.title: Great exploring for kids ages 2 to 10
data.text: There are several rooms to  explore from the water play, creative art and play, farm stead, and others.  There is a special room for toddlers which is off limits for older kids.  The area is inclosed and safe for all. My grandchildren went there at least twice a year and still loved going back.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: A great way to spend a few hours if you have young children.  Kids over 7 really will not enjoy.  They have about 7 play areas and you may get 15 minutes of playtime in each.  This museum is small and definitely does not compare to other children's museums in the country.
